tools.name: search-emails
tools.title: Search Emails
tools.description: Search for emails in Apple Mail.
tools.instructions:
Try multiple queries with different keywords if your first attempt doesn't succeed. For example,
when looking for a meeting with John Smith, search separately for "meeting", "john smith", and "john".

IMPORTANT: Always try at least 2-3 different search terms before concluding the
email can't be found. If specific searches fail, try broader terms related to the
content you're seeking.

search.description:
The search query compared against the email subject and content.

Supports regular expressions.

before.description:
Filter emails sent before the given date.

Date must be in the format "YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm".

after.description:
Filter emails sent after the given date.

Date must be in the format "YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm".

from.description:
Filter emails sent from the given email address.

You can use the `list-addresses` tool to get a list of email addresses.

order.description:
Sort the results in ascending or descending order by date received.

@default "desc"

tools.name: read-email
tools.title: Read Email
tools.description: Read the full content of an email.

filePath.description:
File path of the email to read.

You can get the file path using the `search-messages` tool.

query.description: Filter addresses by the given query.

tools.name: send-email
tools.title: Send Email
tools.description: Send an email with Apple Mail.

to.description:
The recipient email addresses.

This must be a valid email address from the account's address book
which you must get using the `list-addresses` tool.

cc.description:
The recipient email addresses to CC.

This must be a valid email address from the account's address book
which you must get using the `list-addresses` tool.

bcc.description:
The recipient email addresses to BCC.

This must be a valid email address from the account's address book
which you must get using the `list-addresses` tool.

subject.description:
The subject of the email.

Always include a relevant subject, but don't include any prefixes such as "Re:".

content.description:
The content of the message.
Don't include any introduction or salutation. Just the main content.

attachments.description: A list of absolute file paths to attach to the email.

ai.instructions: If you can't access the Apple Mail database, tell the user they need to give Raycast the full disk access permission in the system settings. Be detailed about the steps.
